definition: to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

pinyin: yong4 hu4 chuang4 zao4 nei4 rong2

definition: to invent and innovate/inventions and innovations

sentences.english: God knows that , and created us totally free.
sentences.chinese: 上主深明此理，因此將我們創造成了自由。

sentences.english: The previous record was held by an Indian man who delivered a 120-hour speech.
sentences.chinese: 此前的紀錄爲120小時，由一個印度人創造。

sentences.english: He is one of the most talented and inventive drummers in modern music.
sentences.chinese: 他是現代音樂界最具天賦和創造力的鼓手之一。

sentences.english: Thev artist does all the active work, makes the biggest emotional investment.
sentences.chinese: 藝術家獨攬了所有的創造性工作，投入了大量的心血。

sentences.english: What if last night God destroyed my soul and put in a new soul?
sentences.chinese: 如果昨晚上帝毀掉了我的靈魂並創造了新的那怎麼辦？
小心圖表建造者創造的幻覺。

sentences.english: Here at Moviefone, we promote a safe work environment.
sentences.chinese: 在拍皇冠網址時，我們創造一個安全的工作環境。

sentences.english: There is a limit to the amount of creative talent available in the world.
sentences.chinese: 人世間的創造力是有一定限度的。

sentences.english: Shared laughter creates a bond of friendships.
sentences.chinese: 分享歡笑創造友誼的結合力。

sentences.english: B    God is the all powerful creator and sustainer of the Universe.
sentences.chinese: 上帝是宇宙間萬能的創造者和支撐者。

sentences.english: They help to open man's perception and expand his approaches to creativity.
sentences.chinese: 他們能夠幫助解放人的感知力，拓展人的創造能力。

sentences.english: Living beings don’t create life, they re-purpose existing matter into offspring.
sentences.chinese: 衆生不創造生命，他們用現有的東西重新繁衍後代。
共同創造把人們都吸引了進去。

sentences.english: She had sex with 919 guys in a single day, setting a world record.
sentences.chinese: 她在一天和919個男人完成性愛，創造了世界紀錄。

sentences.english: These projects showed the wisdom and innovativeness of the participating students.
sentences.chinese: 這些資助項目反映出大學生們的智慧和創造力。

sentences.english: The negative tendencies that accompany any creative project are strong.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨任何創造性項目的負面趨勢都是強烈的。

definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to achieve/to implement/to realize/to bring about
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to assign/to entrust (a task)/to give/to bestow
to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
